item.title: Copysets: Reducing the Frequency of Data Loss in Cloud Storage
item.author: Xing Lin
item.description: Summary Copysets proposed another approach/perspective for data replication, than the traditional random replication. In random replication, N nodes are selected randomly from the cluster to store a data chunk. Random replication provides a strong protection against uncorrelated failures. For each individual chunk, since it can be stored randomly at N nodes in the cluster, it is quite resilient to data loss. However, when we consider all data chunks, any N node failure will almost lead to loss of some chunks, as long as these chunks happen to be replicated at these exact N nodes.
